Vinesign is a powerful digital signature tool that is trusted by 1,500+ organizations for fast, secure, and simple eSignature. Its easy-to-use interface allows you to speed up signature collection with reusable templates for your most popular documents.

As a Justia Connect member, you are eligible for a 30-day free trial of Vinesign, including text message signature requests, drag-and-drop fields to create customized templates, and more!

Google updated its AI chatbot, Bard, to Gemini (its latest and most advanced AI model), offering its own Android app and introducing a paid version named Gemini Advanced.

Google Will Update Its Core Web Vitals Metrics on March 12

Google has officially announced that as of March 12, 2024, the Interaction to Next Paint (INP) metric will replace First Input Delay (FID) as a Core Web Vital.

Justia Webinars

Upcoming Presentations
Free Law: Resources, Technology & Legal Issues (Past, Present & Future)

Explore free legal research solutions in our webinar on Free Law with Justia CEO Tim Stanley. Discover key resources and delve into legal issues like copyright, privacy, and public access. Tim will trace the history and technology behind organizations offering free legal resources, examining the Free Law movement's evolution since the 1990s. Uncover the impact of litigation and court decisions on this movement, including notable cases like HyperLaw and Public Resource. Tim will also address legal concerns related to AI training with court records and government documents, exploring their implications for legal research and AI. Throughout the webinar, Tim will guide you to the best online sources for free law, covering Federal and US state, educational, and organizational websites. Join us for a cost-effective exploration of the legal landscape!

Recent Recordings
The Addicted Lawyer. How We Got Here. Where We Are Headed.

Substance use disorders in the legal community are a well-known issue that can substantially impair an attorneyâ€™s ability to practice law and adhere to professional obligations. In this CLE-accredited webinar, Brian Cuban explores the impacts of mental health and recovery in the legal profession. Please note this program is accredited for one hour of Prevention and Detection Competence MCLE credit in California, one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in North Carolina, and one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health credit in South Carolina (all levels). It has also been submitted to the Texas Commission on MCLE for review of CLE accreditation status.

News From Justia

Pennsylvania Congressman Faces Ballot Disqualification Lawsuit

Section 3 of the Fourteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution disqualifies individuals from holding office if they previously took an oath to support the Constitution and later engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the United States. Pennsylvania Congressman Scott Perry is the latest to confront a challenge under Section 3, with activist Gene Stilp arguing for his disqualification, alleging involvement in disrupting the transfer of administrations.

Catch up on this and other breaking news on the Justia Legal News Blog.
